page.title: 07HOLY TRINITY CHURCH,cont.
page.content: The{FONT}is Norman. The{ALTAR RAILS}are Jacobean. The{NORTH AISLE CEILING}has Tudor bosses.The{SOUTH AISLE CEILING}is held up by 36 carved angels.It is an oak waggon roof of the 15th. Century. The{TOWER}has walls five feet thick.It contains 6 bells cast in 1783 and rehung in 1970.We have a skilled team of ringers who win competitions. The{CLOCK}is wound once a week by Mr. Crocker.The schoolchildren went up the spiral staircase in the tower to watch Mr. Crocker wind up the heavy weight using a crank.The weight drops down two storeys inside a case. Sarah's report: When you are going up it is quite easy, but when you are going down it is hard. You hold on to the walls.You can break your leg if you fall down. When you come back down you feel funny.
